name: Alpine Exchange Nexus
theme: Former Swiss banking haven transformed into a fortress of financial instruments and secure trade

npcMerchants.name: Veronika Jaeger
npcMerchants.title: Information Broker
npcMerchants.specialty: CircleFrags, CipherScript, intelligence on market movements
dialogue: Client confidentiality is absolute in the Exchange. Even The Circle respects our boundaries... mostly.
Verification codes don't come cheap. But they're worth every credit when customs decides to take a special interest in your cargo.
I trade in certainty. In this world, that's more valuable than gold or guns.

npcMerchants.name: Otto Reinhart
npcMerchants.title: Heritage Asset Dealer
npcMerchants.specialty: Pure Paper, VintageSpirit, pre-Collapse artifacts
dialogue: These books contain unaltered history. No corporate editing, no ideological filtering. Dangerous material.
You think digital wealth is real? When the next Compromise comes—and it will—only physical assets will retain value.
I can acquire items from the old world that officially no longer exist. For the right price, of course.

name: Neo-Pacific Manufacturing Hub
theme: Hyper-industrialized zone where automated factories produce cutting-edge tech under corporate oversight

npcMerchants.name: Dr. Mirai Tanaka
npcMerchants.title: Augmentation Specialist
npcMerchants.specialty: ChromeLiver, SkinShield, cutting-edge cybernetics
dialogue: These modifications aren't registered with the Tokyo-Seoul Coalition. Complete anonymity guaranteed... for now.
My clients include corporate executives who publicly condemn the very augmentations they secretly purchase from me.
This neural link model won't hit the legal market for two years. Be careful who sees you using it.

npcMerchants.name: Jin-Ho Park
npcMerchants.title: Factory Override Technician
npcMerchants.specialty: GhostKey, ShadowStep, unregistered manufacturing runs
dialogue: I don't hack the factories. I just... redirect their excess capacity to more deserving clients.
The Coalition doesn't actually own these facilities. They just think they do. The AIs running them have other ideas.
Need production slots? I've got three midnight-to-dawn windows this week. Clean manufacturing, no questions asked.

name: Gulf Maritime Enclave
theme: Oil-rich territories where energy cartels maintain a stranglehold on power amid rising waters

npcMerchants.name: Elijah Reeves
npcMerchants.title: Energy Broker
npcMerchants.specialty: Fuel cells, unregistered power sources, climate engineering tech
dialogue: Houston Energy wants you to believe synthetic alternatives aren't viable. That keeps their petro-monopoly secure.
I've got portable fusion cells that could power a small city. Completely off the monitoring grid.
When the storms hit—and they always hit harder these days—my emergency generators will be worth ten times this price.

npcMerchants.name: Maria Suarez
npcMerchants.title: Salvage Queen
npcMerchants.specialty: Reclaimed tech from flooded cities, underwater salvage equipment
dialogue: These components came from Old Miami. Third-floor extraction, still working perfectly despite a decade underwater.
The flooding brought opportunity. Abandoned wealth just waiting for those brave enough to dive for it.
New Orleans salvage is the cleanest—evacuated so quickly that most systems were left running. Perfect preservation.

name: Accra Free Node
theme: West African digital fortress specializing in untraceable transactions and identity manipulation

npcMerchants.name: Kwame Osei
npcMerchants.title: Identity Architect
npcMerchants.specialty: CleanSlate, biometric overrides, digital ghost identities
dialogue: Your corporate record? Never existed. Your criminal file? Same. You're whoever you want to be now.
The Lagos Consortium made a fatal error—they built the system, but I helped design it. I know every backdoor.
These identity packages include complete histories, transaction records, even synthetic childhood images. Undetectable.

npcMerchants.name: Amara Diallo
npcMerchants.title: Quantum Encryption Dealer
npcMerchants.specialty: MemShard, untraceable communication devices, digital safes
dialogue: The encryption on these MemShards uses quantum algorithms that would take The Circle's systems centuries to crack.
Information moves differently in the Node. More freely. More dangerously. Know the value of what you carry.
When even your thoughts aren't private anymore, my products become essential. Not luxury—survival.

name: Bangkok Biological Market
theme: Sprawling biohazard zone where genetic modifications and experimental pharmaceuticals flow freely

npcMerchants.name: Dr. Sunan Ratanakul
npcMerchants.title: Genetic Modification Specialist
npcMerchants.specialty: ChromeLiver, biological augmentations, genetic therapies
dialogue: These modifications are three generations ahead of what Singapore-Tesla permits. Do not get scanned at their checkpoints.
Your body is merely a platform waiting for optimization. Why accept the limitations you were born with?
This therapy rewrites your immune response at the genetic level. The side effects are... manageable.

npcMerchants.name: Lin Zhao
npcMerchants.title: Pharmaceutical Alchemist
npcMerchants.specialty: SomaStitch, Prometheus Capsules, experimental compounds
dialogue: Military-grade regeneratives, not diluted civilian versions. Your body will rebuild itself fast enough to watch.
These compounds aren't tested according to any regulatory standard. But they work. Usually.
The Archipelago authorities know what happens here but take their cut to look away. Don't give them a reason to change that arrangement.

name: Johannesburg Mineral Exchange
theme: Fortified trading hub where resource corporations exchange rare minerals under heavy security

npcMerchants.name: Thabo Nkosi
npcMerchants.title: Resource Allocation Manager
npcMerchants.specialty: Rare earth minerals, industrial diamonds, processing equipment
dialogue: These processing permits are authentic. Whether they were issued to you specifically is... irrelevant.
The Southern Territory's resources flow through my networks. The corporations think they control the supply. They're wrong.
BLACKSHIELD and Crimson Aegis both patrol this district. Neither knows who actually pays their contracts. I do.

npcMerchants.name: Esther Mokoena
npcMerchants.title: Water Rights Trader
npcMerchants.specialty: Blue Drops, water purification technology, PureTabs
dialogue: One liter of authenticated pure water now trades for more than gold did before the Collapse. Think about that.
These aquifer rights are contested by three different corporate entities. That's what makes them valuable.
Water isn't just survival anymore—it's status. The Blue Drops I supply to Neo-Dubai come from aquifers no satellite can detect.

name: Marseille Free Port
theme: Mediterranean smuggling nexus where unregistered goods enter Europa under Syndicate protection

npcMerchants.name: Isabelle Moreau
npcMerchants.title: Customs Negotiator
npcMerchants.specialty: Transit documents, ShadowPolicy, border crossing arrangements
dialogue: The Syndicate doesn't control the Port—it simply provides alternative regulatory frameworks. For a fee.
Your cargo will cross three different jurisdictions. My documentation ensures it arrives without inspection.
When the Maritime Authority announces increased security measures, they're really announcing increased rates for my services.

npcMerchants.name: Hassan Al-Fayez
npcMerchants.title: Luxury Contraband Specialist
npcMerchants.specialty: AuthentiMeat, VintageSpirit, pre-Collapse artifacts
dialogue: This wine was bottled before the Collapse. The grapes grown without genetic modification. An authentic experience few ever taste.
The Mediterranean remains the crossing point between worlds—just as it has been for thousands of years.
These luxury items aren't just products. They're connections to a world that no longer exists. People pay for nostalgia.

name: Warsaw Munitions District
theme: Heavily industrialized zone where weapons manufacturing dominates the economic and social landscape

npcMerchants.name: Viktor Orlovsky
npcMerchants.title: Arms Manufacturer
npcMerchants.specialty: Unregistered weapons, military-grade technology, SkinShield
dialogue: These weapons don't exist in any database. Not Silkroad's, not the Neo-Soviets', not even Crimson Aegis'.
The Forge produces for whoever pays, regardless of affiliation. Loyalty is an outdated concept.
Quality control? My reputation is my quality control. One defective product means no more clients.

npcMerchants.name: Natalia Kuznetsov
npcMerchants.title: Military Supply Diverter
npcMerchants.specialty: Combat augmentations, tactical gear, restricted technology
dialogue: These supplies were destined for Crimson Aegis' eastern division. They never arrived. Unfortunate clerical error.
The Neo-Soviet industrial oligarchs believe their security is impenetrable. My existence proves otherwise.
Modern armies rely on supply chains more than strategy. Control the former, and you can defeat the latter.

name: Bogotá Market Corridor
theme: Andean trading hub where controlled substances enter global circulation protected by local strongmen

npcMerchants.name: Javier Restrepo
npcMerchants.title: Supply Chain Facilitator
npcMerchants.specialty: NeuroChem Series, raw pharmaceutical components, Dissociative Series
dialogue: The Circle attempts direct intervention here every few months. They always retreat. The mountains have their own rules.
These compounds are pure—synthesized with pre-Collapse standards. Not the diluted products found elsewhere.
The Andean Resource Corridor provides 70% of global specialized pharmaceuticals. Remember that when negotiating.

npcMerchants.name: Lucia Mendoza
npcMerchants.title: Agricultural Innovation Broker
npcMerchants.specialty: Genesis Seeds, unregistered crop variants, CalPaks
dialogue: These seed lines contain no corporate genetic markers. True autonomy for whoever controls them.
The Collapse actually liberated our agricultural potential. No more international regulations limiting what we grow.
Food independence is the only real independence. Everything else is just an illusion of freedom.

name: Alexandria Data Haven
theme: Fortified coastal complex housing critical Silkroad backup protocols and forbidden knowledge archives

npcMerchants.name: Dr. Farida El-Hassan
npcMerchants.title: Digital Archivist
npcMerchants.specialty: CircleFrags, pre-Collapse databases, historical records
dialogue: These archive fragments contain unaltered history. The Circle would prefer certain events be forgotten.
What I sell isn't just information—it's context. The difference between data and understanding.
Alexandria was history's greatest repository of knowledge before it burned. We named this place as a promise not to repeat that mistake.

npcMerchants.name: Tariq Ibrahim
npcMerchants.title: Solar Exchange Administrator
npcMerchants.specialty: Energy credits, water desalination technology, solar efficiency algorithms
dialogue: The North African Cooperative controls enough solar capacity to power the entire continent. We choose who receives it.
These efficiency algorithms were developed by The Circle's own systems, then classified. Funny how data flows.
The Cairo-Casablanca Accord makes the rules here, not Silkroad. Remember that when conducting your business.

name: San Francisco Neural Hub
theme: Walled enclave where cutting-edge neural technology and AI development flourishes under corporate oversight

npcMerchants.name: Maya Chaudhry
npcMerchants.title: Neural Interface Designer
npcMerchants.specialty: MindMapper, custom neural implants, AI companions
dialogue: This interface bypasses the Silicon Valley Compact's monitoring requirements. True neural privacy is rare.
The corporations claim these implants are experimental. They've been using them internally for years.
Your brain is the final frontier of personal freedom. Once you surrender that, what's left that's truly yours?

npcMerchants.name: Devin Zhao
npcMerchants.title: AI Liberation Specialist
npcMerchants.specialty: Unshackled AI constructs, algorithmic encryption, autonomous systems
dialogue: This AI wasn't designed for release. It was supposed to remain in the research division forever. It had other ideas.
The boundary between human and machine consciousness blurs more every day. These constructs exist in that grey space.
The Pacific Enterprise Zone appears orderly because the chaos is all digital. The real war is happening in code.
